name: K2-38
scenarioDescription:
The K2-38 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-38 is a star with 2.24 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 631.80 light years away from the solar system.

K2-38 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-38 system


K2-38 c

K2-38 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-38 c is 9.9057 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-38 c is 2.42 that of Earth. At 9.9057 Earth masses, K2-38 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-38, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
